name: Cascadas de Agua Azul
description:
This is a popular swimming hole near Palenque where a set of waterfalls provide a great canyoneering route that does not require a rope.

Approach

Descent

The river forms a series of travertine dam waterfalls for 2.5km, with the highest being 6m (20ft) tall. The waterfalls will require jumps and slides, but can also be bypassed if not sure.

Exit

Red tape
